[SYNTAX]: Occasionally complex, lengthy sentences with multiple clauses (e.g., "It should be talked about...").
[LEXICON]: Repetitive descriptors (e.g., "gaiety, courage, vitality" and "exuberant and exhilarating").

[STRUCTURE]: Mildly abrupt transition between biographical anecdotes (e.g., shift from fatherâ€™s advice to beach activities).
[CLARITY]: Dense, specific details (e.g., food items, locations) that slightly slow narrative flow.

[SPELLING]: Question mark in "heated (?) with one stove" disrupts clarity.

[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shift to describing the faker without clear connection to preceding narrative.
